title: DIRT TO DIGITAL
features: What do you suppose life was like for the average caveman some 100,000 years ago? Consider the challenges it placed on the budding writers of the time; they were around then just as sure as they are now. Written with a dash of humor, our journey delivers us from past to present. Along the way, discover the milestones of literature that contributed to its many great achievements. Weâ€™ve come a long way.
description: "This short story does a superb job of shedding light on the history of literature."

author: {'avatar': 'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/S/amzn-author-media-prod/5kjjhn65ajtra81ujl41tcgdi._SY600_.jpg', 'name': 'Paul Falk', 'about': ['Paul Falk began his journey in literature as a reader. He owes his early success in large part to the fabled series: SEE SPOT RUN. From there, it was off to the races. An introduction to writing occurred with his membership into Goodreads; it was the driving force that stoked the writer in him.', "Paul's first publication began with an essay, DIRT TO DIGITAL. That's all it took to get him rolling. In no time, CAGED, his first novel surfaced. Just a few months later, his sequel appeared - THE LINE. He has since published his final book of a trilogy, EARTHBOUND.", "Paul received his master's degree in Audiology from San Diego State University.
